transportAdvice: San Jose has an extensive public bus network that covers most tourist areas and neighborhoods, though buses can be crowded and routes may be confusing for first-time visitors. Taxis are widely available throughout the city, and walking is practical in specific central districts but less advisable in outlying areas due to traffic and uneven sidewalks.

weather.description: January is dry and pleasant with cool evenings, making it one of the best months to visit.
February remains dry and sunny with comfortable temperatures throughout the day.
March is warm and dry, one of the hottest months of the dry season with clear skies.
April marks the transition to the rainy season with occasional afternoon showers beginning.
May brings the onset of the rainy season with frequent afternoon and evening downpours.
June is wet with heavy rainfall most afternoons, though mornings are often clear.
July often brings a brief dry spell known as veranillo, with reduced rainfall mid-month.
August returns to heavy rainfall patterns with lush green surroundings throughout the city.
September is typically the wettest month with persistent rain and overcast skies.
October remains very wet and is generally considered the least favorable month for travel.
November sees rainfall beginning to ease as the dry season gradually approaches.
December transitions into the dry season with cooler, more comfortable conditions and festive atmosphere.
